transcript: the treachery of the Austrians, a defective commissariat, the treachery of the Pole Przeby- szwski and of the Frenchman Langeron, Ku- tuzov's incapacity, and (it was whispered) the youth and inexperience of the sovereign, who had trusted worthless and insignificant people. But the army, the Russian army, everyone de- clared, was extraordinary and had achieved miracles of valor. The soldiers, officers, and gen- erals were heroes.
